title: Why People with More Than Enough Money Still Struggle to Retire
subtitle: Explore the psychological and practical barriers to enjoying a well-deserved retirement.
content:
Why People with More Than Enough Money Still Struggle to Retire

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. If any of this is helpful, check out my free newsletter by clicking the link in my bio.

1. Difficulty Shifting Gears

After decades of saving, many retirees struggle to shift gears. They physically can't spend without guilt, and it feels irresponsible even when the math says they’re fine.

2. Fear of the First Withdrawal

That first dollar spent feels like a cliff. But it’s not; it's a long, slow stroll downhill, and guess what? You packed a very nice picnic!

3. Ignoring Health’s Timeline

Many forget that health has a clock too. The best travel years are often in your 60s. Don’t save every trip for your 80s unless you’re really into cruise ship oxygen tanks! If that’s your thing, that’s awesome. You do you!
